SEARCH
Package com.greenloop.event_service.services

Class EventService

java.lang.Object
com.greenloop.event_service.services.EventService
@Service public class EventService extends Object
Service layer handling all event-related business logic.

This service provides comprehensive event management capabilities including:

  • CRUD operations (create, read, update, delete events)
  • Event queries (get all events, get by ID, filter by status)
  • User-event relationships (upcoming/past events for users)
  • Analytics (event statistics and participation metrics)
All event responses include attendee counts and QR token information for event check-in.

Version:
1.0
Author:
GreenLoop Team

  • Constructor Details

    • EventService

      public EventService()

  • Method Details

    • createEvent

      public EventResponse createEvent(CreateEventRequest request)
      Creates a new event with the provided details.

      Automatically generates a unique QR token and sets initial status to REGISTRATION.

      Parameters:
      request - the event creation request containing all event details
      Returns:
      EventResponse containing the created event details with generated ID and QR token

    • updateEvent

      public EventResponse updateEvent(UUID id, UpdateEventRequest request)
      Updates an existing event with new details.
      Parameters:
      id - the UUID of the event to update
      request - the update request containing modified event details
      Returns:
      EventResponse containing the updated event details
      Throws:
      EventNotFoundException - if no event exists with the given ID

    • deleteEvent

      public void deleteEvent(UUID id)
      Deletes an event by ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the UUID of the event to delete
      Throws:
      EventNotFoundException - if no event exists with the given ID

    • getAllEvents

      public List<EventResponse> getAllEvents()
      Retrieves all events in the system.
      Returns:
      list of all events as EventResponse objects

    • getEventById

      public EventResponse getEventById(UUID id)
      Retrieves a specific event by its ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the UUID of the event to retrieve
      Returns:
      EventResponse containing the event details
      Throws:
      EventNotFoundException - if no event exists with the given ID

    • upcomingEventForUser

      public List<EventResponse> upcomingEventForUser(UUID userId)
      Retrieves all upcoming events that a user has joined.

      Only returns events where the start date is after the current time.

      Parameters:
      userId - the UUID of the user
      Returns:
      list of upcoming events the user has joined

    • pastEventsForUser

      public List<EventResponse> pastEventsForUser(UUID userId)
      Retrieves all past events that a user has attended.

      Only returns events where the end date is before the current time.

      Parameters:
      userId - the UUID of the user
      Returns:
      list of past events the user has attended

    • upcomingNotJoinedEventsForUser

      public List<EventResponse> upcomingNotJoinedEventsForUser(UUID userId)
      Retrieves all upcoming events that a user has NOT joined yet and can still join.

      Filters events based on:

      • End date is after current time (event not ended)
      • Event has available capacity
      • User has not already joined the event

      Parameters:
      userId - the UUID of the user
      Returns:
      list of joinable upcoming events

    • getAllEventTypes

      public EventType[] getAllEventTypes()
      Retrieves all available event types.
      Returns:
      array of all EventType enum values

    • getTotalOpenEvents

      public long getTotalOpenEvents()
      Counts the total number of open (non-closed) events.
      Returns:
      count of events that are not in CLOSED status

    • getUpcomingEventsNext30Days

      public long getUpcomingEventsNext30Days()
      Counts upcoming events starting within the next 30 days.
      Returns:
      count of events starting between now and 30 days from now

    • getTotalParticipantsInOpenEvents

      public long getTotalParticipantsInOpenEvents()
      Calculates the total number of participants across all open events.
      Returns:
      sum of attendee counts for all non-closed events
